intro: Coussapoa latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf coussapoa, is a species of flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, broad leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in swampy or wetland areas. Due to its unique appearance and ecological importance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
